title: Boško Mihajlović
text:
Boško Mihajlović (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic">Serbian Cyrillic</a>: Бошко Михајловић; born October 10, 1971) is a <a href="Serbs">Serbian</a> former <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a>.
Mihajlović started his career in <a href="FK%20Proleter%20Zrenjanin">FK Proleter Zrenjanin</a> in 1992. He played 6 seasons for Proleter (1992-1997) and then one and a half season for <a href="Panachaiki%20F.C.">Panachaiki F.C.</a> from <a href="Greece">Greece</a>. After two seasons in <a href="Greece">Greece</a> he moved to <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a> again to sign for <a href="FK%20Rad">FK Rad</a>. He stayed in Rad for two seasons when he moved again to Proleter.
In 2002, he suffers injury and retires from Proleter. Two years later and he returns to football, this time as player-manager for semi-professional club FK Mladost Lukićevo. Finally, in 2006 he moved to FK Naftagas Elemir where he retires from football in 2010.
